page.title: 07THE NAPOLEON ROOM (cont)
page.content: The room also contains the Emperor's state chair and shaving stand as well as Wellington's campaign chair. One of the most interesting items on view is the sketch by{David}of the {Coronation of Josephine.}This is slightly different from the finished picture which hangs in the{Louvre. The 5th Earl's interest prompted him to write{"Napoleon:The Last Phase", published in 1909. By writing about Napoleon when he was a powerless prisoner, the Earl captured the man very effectively. He wrote about Napoleon's political theories and opinions sympathetically (his own political experiences permitted this) and convincingly shows how Napoleon rose to power on the backs of the {Jacobins,}a French Revolutionary group, but refused to turn to the people to retain his throne.
